snippet: Wilson, whose N.F.L. career with the Giants was cut short by a neck injury, will make his professional track and field debut in the triple jump on Saturday in the Adidas Grand Prix.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column profiles former New York Giants running back David Wilson, whose NFL career was cut short by neck injury; notes that Wilson will make his professional track and field debut in triple jump at Adidas Grand Prix meet.
lead_paragraph: Wilson, whose N.F.L. career with the Giants was cut short by a neck injury, will make his professional track and field debut in the triple jump on Saturday in the Adidas Grand Prix.

headline.main: David Wilson Makes Jump (Actually Three) to Life After N.F.L.
headline.print_headline: Making Jump (Actually Three) to Life After N.F.L.
